009package com.weather.sdk;
010
011import com.weather.sdk.cache.DefaultWeatherCache;
012import com.weather.sdk.cache.WeatherCache;
013import com.weather.sdk.client.DefaultOpenWeatherApiClient;
014import com.weather.sdk.client.OpenWeatherApiClient;
015import com.weather.sdk.config.SDKConfiguration;
016import com.weather.sdk.config.SDKMode;
017import com.weather.sdk.exception.WeatherSDKException;
018import com.weather.sdk.model.WeatherData;
019import java.net.http.HttpClient;
020import java.time.Duration;
021import java.time.Instant;
022import java.util.Optional;
023import java.util.concurrent.Executors;
024import java.util.concurrent.ScheduledExecutorService;
025import java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture;
026import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
027import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicLong;
028import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference;
029import org.slf4j.Logger;
030import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;

032/**
033 * Default implementation of WeatherSDK interface for Phase 1.
034 *
035 * <p>This implementation provides full production-ready functionality including:
036 *
037 * <ul>
038 *   <li>Intelligent caching with LRU eviction and TTL support
039 *   <li>HTTP client integration with OpenWeatherAPI
040 *   <li>Comprehensive metrics collection and tracking
041 *   <li>Thread-safe operations for concurrent access
042 *   <li>Proper resource management and lifecycle handling
043 * </ul>
044 *
045 * <p><strong>Thread Safety:</strong> This implementation is thread-safe and supports concurrent
046 * access from multiple threads without external synchronization. All operations use thread-safe
047 * collections and atomic variables for metrics tracking.
048 *
049 * @since 1.0.0
050 * @see WeatherSDK
051 */
052@SuppressWarnings({"PMD.TooManyMethods", "PMD.LawOfDemeter", "CT_CONSTRUCTOR_THROW"})
053public class DefaultWeatherSDK implements WeatherSDK {
054
055  /** Logger for this class. */
056  private static final Logger LOGGER = LoggerFactory.getLogger(DefaultWeatherSDK.class);
057
058  /** The SDK configuration used to create this instance. */
059  private final SDKConfiguration configuration;
060
061  /** Weather cache for storing and retrieving cached weather data. */
062  private final WeatherCache weatherCache;
063
064  /** HTTP client for making requests to OpenWeatherAPI. */
065  private final HttpClient httpClient;
066
067  /** OpenWeatherAPI client for fetching weather data. */
068  private final OpenWeatherApiClient apiClient;
069
070  /** Scheduled executor service for polling mode. */
071  private ScheduledExecutorService pollingExecutor;
072
073  /** Future task for the polling scheduler. */
074  private ScheduledFuture<?> pollingTask;
075
076  /** Flag indicating whether this instance has been shut down. */
077  private volatile boolean closed;
078
079  /** Total number of API requests made. */
080  private final AtomicLong totalRequests = new AtomicLong(0);
081
082  /** Number of successful API requests. */
083  private final AtomicLong successCount = new AtomicLong(0);
084
085  /** Number of failed API requests. */
086  private final AtomicLong failedCount = new AtomicLong(0);
087
088  /** Number of cache hits. */
089  private final AtomicLong cacheHits = new AtomicLong(0);
090
091  /** Number of cache misses. */
092  private final AtomicLong cacheMisses = new AtomicLong(0);
093
094  /** Total response time for calculating averages. */
095  private final AtomicLong totalResponseTime = new AtomicLong(0);
096
097  /** Timestamp of the last API call. */
098  private final AtomicReference<Instant> lastApiCallTime = new AtomicReference<>();
099
100  /**
101   * Constructs a new DefaultWeatherSDK with the specified configuration.
102   *
103   * @param configuration the SDK configuration (must not be null)
104   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if configuration is null
105   */
106  @SuppressWarnings("CT_CONSTRUCTOR_THROW")
107  public DefaultWeatherSDK(final SDKConfiguration configuration) {
108    // Validate configuration first to avoid NPE
109    if (configuration == null) {
110      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Configuration must not be null");
111    }
112
113    // Initialize fields first to avoid partial initialization
114    this.configuration = configuration;
115
116    // Initialize weather cache
117    this.weatherCache =
118        new DefaultWeatherCache(configuration.getCacheTTL(), configuration.getCacheSize());
119
120    // Initialize HTTP client with configured timeouts
121    final Duration connectionTimeout = configuration.getConnectionTimeout();
122    final int connTimeoutSec = configuration.getConnectionTimeoutSeconds();
123    this.httpClient = HttpClient.newBuilder().connectTimeout(connectionTimeout).build();
124
125    // Initialize API client with retry configuration
126    final int readTimeoutSec = configuration.getReadTimeoutSeconds();
127    this.apiClient =
128        new DefaultOpenWeatherApiClient(
129            httpClient,
130            connTimeoutSec,
131            readTimeoutSec,
132            configuration.getMaxRetries(),
133            configuration.getRetryDelayMs());
134
135    // Initialize polling if in POLLING mode
136    // PMD suppression: Law of Demeter - accessing configuration properties is
137    // acceptable
138    if (configuration.getMode() == SDKMode.POLLING) {
139      initializePolling();
140    }
141  }
142
143  /**
144   * Returns the SDK configuration used to create this instance.
145   *
146   * @return the SDK configuration
147   */
148  public SDKConfiguration getConfiguration() {
149    return configuration;
150  }
151
152  /**
153   * Retrieves current weather data for the specified city with intelligent caching.
154   *
155   * <p>This method implements the following logic:
156   *
157   * <ol>
158   *   <li>Validates the SDK is not shut down
159   *   <li>Normalizes the city name (trimmed, lowercase)
160   *   <li>Checks cache first for fresh data (within TTL)
161   *   <li>If cache hit: records metrics and returns cached data
162   *   <li>If cache miss: fetches from OpenWeatherAPI
163   *   <li>Caches successful API responses
164   *   <li>Records all metrics for performance tracking
165   * </ol>
166   *
167   * @param cityName the name of the city to retrieve weather for (must not be null or empty)
168   * @return the current weather data for the specified city
169   * @throws WeatherSDKException for weather-related errors (API key, network, etc.)
170   * @throws InterruptedException if the operation is interrupted during retry attempts
171   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if cityName is null or empty after trimming
172   * @throws IllegalStateException if this SDK instance has been shut down
173   */
174  @Override
175  public WeatherData getWeather(final String cityName)
176      throws WeatherSDKException, InterruptedException {
177    validateNotShutdown();
178    validateCityName(cityName);
179
180    final String normCity = cityName.trim().toLowerCase(java.util.Locale.ROOT);
181    final long startTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
182    boolean success = false;
183    WeatherData result;
184
185    try {
186      // Check cache first
187      final Optional<WeatherData> cachedWeather = weatherCache.get(normCity);
188
189      if (cachedWeather.isPresent()) {
190        // Cache hit
191        cacheHits.incrementAndGet();
192        result = cachedWeather.get();
193        success = true;
194      } else {
195        // Cache miss - fetch from API
196        cacheMisses.incrementAndGet();
197        result = fetchFromApi(normCity, startTime);
198        success = true;
199      }
200    } finally {
201      recordMetrics(success, System.currentTimeMillis() - startTime);
202    }
203
204    return result;
205  }
206
207  /**
208   * Fetches weather data from the API and caches the result.
209   *
210   * @param cityName the normalized city name
211   * @param startTime the start time for metrics calculation
212   * @return the fetched weather data
213   * @throws WeatherSDKException if the API call fails
214   * @throws InterruptedException if the operation is interrupted
215   */
216  private WeatherData fetchFromApi(final String cityName, final long startTime)
217      throws WeatherSDKException, InterruptedException {
218    // Fetch weather data from API
219    final WeatherData weatherData = apiClient.fetchWeather(cityName, configuration.getApiKey());
220
221    // Cache the result for future requests
222    weatherCache.put(cityName, weatherData);
223
224    recordMetrics(true, System.currentTimeMillis() - startTime);
225    return weatherData;
226  }
227
228  /**
229   * Records metrics for the operation.
230   *
231   * @param success whether the operation was successful
232   * @param responseTime the response time in milliseconds
233   */
234  private void recordMetrics(final boolean success, final long responseTime) {
235    totalRequests.incrementAndGet();
236    totalResponseTime.addAndGet(responseTime);
237    lastApiCallTime.set(Instant.now());
238
239    if (success) {
240      successCount.incrementAndGet();
241    } else {
242      failedCount.incrementAndGet();
243    }
244  }
245
246  /**
247   * Returns current SDK performance and usage metrics.
248   *
249   * <p>This method provides insights into SDK performance including:
250   *
251   * <ul>
252   *   <li>Total API requests made
253   *   <li>Cache hit/miss statistics
254   *   <li>API success/failure rates
255   *   <li>Average response times
256   *   <li>Last API call timestamp
257   * </ul>
258   *
259   * <p><strong>Thread Safety:</strong> This method is safe to call concurrently from multiple
260   * threads. The returned metrics object is a snapshot of current values.
261   *
262   * @return current SDK metrics and performance statistics
263   */
264  @Override
265  public SDKMetrics getMetrics() {
266    validateNotShutdown();
267    final long totalReqs = totalRequests.get();
268    final double avgResponseTime =
269        totalReqs > 0 ? (double) totalResponseTime.get() / totalReqs : 0.0;
270
271    return new SDKMetrics(
272        totalReqs,
273        successCount.get(),
274        failedCount.get(),
275        cacheHits.get(),
276        cacheMisses.get(),
277        avgResponseTime,
278        lastApiCallTime.get());
279  }
280
281  /**
282   * Closes this SDK instance and releases all resources.
283   *
284   * <p>This method delegates to {@link #shutdown()} to ensure consistent resource cleanup.
285   *
286   * <p><strong>Thread Safety:</strong> This method is safe to call concurrently from multiple
287   * threads.
288   *
289   * <p><strong>Idempotent:</strong> This method can be called multiple times safely.
290   */
291  @Override
292  public void close() {
293    shutdown();
294  }
295
296  /**
297   * Checks if this SDK instance has been shut down.
298   *
299   * @return true if shutdown, false otherwise
300   */
301  public boolean isShutdown() {
302    return closed;
303  }
304
305  /**
306   * Validates that this SDK instance is not shut down.
307   *
308   * @throws IllegalStateException if this instance is shut down
309   */
310  protected void validateNotShutdown() {
311    if (closed) {
312      throw new IllegalStateException("SDK instance has been shut down");
313    }
314  }
315
316  /**
317   * Validates the city name parameter.
318   *
319   * @param cityName the city name to validate
320   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if cityName is null or empty after trimming
321   */
322  private void validateCityName(final String cityName) {
323    if (cityName == null || cityName.isBlank()) {
324      throw new IllegalArgumentException("City name must not be null or empty");
325    }
326  }
327
328  /**
329   * Initializes polling mode if the configuration specifies SDKMode.POLLING. This creates a
330   * scheduled task that updates weather data for all cached cities at the configured polling
331   * interval.
332   */
333  private void initializePolling() {
334    this.pollingExecutor =
335        Executors.newSingleThreadScheduledExecutor(
336            runnable -> {
337              final Thread pollingThread = new Thread(runnable, "WeatherSDK-Polling-Thread");
338              pollingThread.setDaemon(true); // Allow JVM to exit even if polling is running
339              return pollingThread;
340            });
341
342    // Schedule the polling task to run at the configured interval
343    // PMD suppression: Law of Demeter - accessing configuration properties is
344    // acceptable
345    this.pollingTask =
346        this.pollingExecutor.scheduleAtFixedRate(
347            this::pollCachedCities,
348            0, // Initial delay
349            configuration.getPollingInterval().toMillis(),
350            TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);
351  }
352
353  /**
354   * Polls all currently cached cities to update their weather data. This method is executed by the
355   * scheduled executor at regular intervals.
356   */
357  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidCatchingGenericException")
358  private void pollCachedCities() {
359    if (closed) {
360      // If the SDK is closed, cancel the polling task
361      if (pollingTask != null && !pollingTask.isCancelled()) {
362        pollingTask.cancel(false);
363      }
364      return;
365    }
366
367    try {
368      // Get all cached city names and update their weather data
369      for (final String cityName : weatherCache.getAllCachedCities()) {
370        try {
371          // Fetch fresh weather data for the city
372          final WeatherData freshWeather =
373              apiClient.fetchWeather(cityName, configuration.getApiKey());
374
375          // Update the cache with fresh data
376          weatherCache.put(cityName, freshWeather);
377
378          // Record successful update metrics
379          recordMetrics(true, 0); // Response time is not applicable for background polling
380        } catch (final Exception e) {
381          // Log the error but continue with other cities
382          // PMD suppression: catching generic exception is intentional here to prevent
383          // one failed city from stopping all polling operations
384          if (LOGGER.isWarnEnabled()) {
385            LOGGER.warn(
386                "Failed to update weather for city: {}, error: {}", cityName, e.getMessage());
387          }
388
389          // Record failed update metrics
390          recordMetrics(false, 0); // Response time is not applicable for background polling
391        }
392      }
393    } catch (final Exception e) {
394      // Catch any unexpected errors during polling
395      // PMD suppression: catching generic exception is intentional here to prevent
396      // polling thread from terminating due to any unexpected error
397      if (LOGGER.isErrorEnabled()) {
398        LOGGER.error("Unexpected error during polling: {}", e.getMessage());
399      }
400    }
401  }
402
403  /**
404   * Gracefully shuts down the SDK instance and releases all associated resources.
405   *
406   * <p>This method performs proper cleanup:
407   *
408   * <ul>
409   *   <li>Stops any background polling threads
410   *   <li>Closes HTTP client connections
411   *   <li>Clears internal resources
412   *   <li>Marks the instance as shut down
413   * </ul>
414   *
415   * <p><strong>Thread Safety:</strong> This method can be called safely from any thread. After
416   * shutdown, subsequent method calls will throw IllegalStateException.
417   *
418   * <p><strong>Idempotent:</strong> This method can be called multiple times safely.
419   */
420  @Override
421  public void shutdown() {
422    if (!closed) {
423      closed = true;
424
425      shutdownPolling();
426
427      // Clear the cache to release memory
428      weatherCache.clear();
429
430      // HTTP client doesn't need explicit shutdown in Java 17
431      // It will be garbage collected when no longer referenced
432    }
433  }
434
435  /** Shuts down the polling executor and associated tasks. */
436  private void shutdownPolling() {
437    // Cancel polling task if it exists
438    if (pollingTask != null && !pollingTask.isCancelled()) {
439      pollingTask.cancel(false);
440    }
441
442    // Shutdown polling executor if it exists
443    if (pollingExecutor != null && !pollingExecutor.isShutdown()) {
444      pollingExecutor.shutdown();
445      try {
446        // Wait up to 5 seconds for existing tasks to terminate
447        if (!pollingExecutor.awaitTermination(5, TimeUnit.SECONDS)) {
448          pollingExecutor.shutdownNow(); // Cancel currently executing tasks
449          // Wait a bit more for tasks to respond to being cancelled
450          if (!pollingExecutor.awaitTermination(5, TimeUnit.SECONDS)) {
451            LOGGER.warn("Polling executor did not terminate");
452          }
453        }
454      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
455        // (Re-)Cancel if current thread also interrupted
456        pollingExecutor.shutdownNow();
457        // Preserve interrupt status
458        Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
459      }
460    }
461  }
